SEARCH
Package CombinedCodes

Class MixedFraction

java.lang.Object
CombinedCodes.Fraction
CombinedCodes.MixedFraction
public class MixedFraction extends Fraction
The MixedFraction class is a subclass of Fraction. This class represents a mixed fraction, inheriting the attributes of the Fraction class with wholeNumber as its unique attribute.

It contains constructors, setter and getter methods, as well as methods for performing basic operations on fractions, including arithmetic operations, extracting the fractional part of a mixed fraction, and converting a mixed fraction to an improper fraction. Additionally, this class includes methods for representing a fraction as a String and as a double.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    MixedFraction(int whole, int numerator, int denominator)
    Constructs a mixed fraction with the given whole number, numerator, and denominator.
    MixedFraction(int whole, Fraction fraction)
    This constructor creates a MixedFraction object with a whole number and a Fraction object, for example, if you want to make a mixed fraction with a whole number and a fraction, let us say you have a whole number = 3 and a fraction = 1/2, this constructor constructs the mixed fraction = 3 1/2.
    MixedFraction(Fraction fraction)
    This constructor creates a MixedFraction object with the given Fraction object.

    • MixedFraction

      public MixedFraction(Fraction fraction)
      This constructor creates a MixedFraction object with the given Fraction object. For example, if you have the fraction 2/4, this constructor will make the mixed fraction 0 1/2 which is just equal to 1/2.

    • toFraction

      public Fraction toFraction()
      This method converts the MixedFraction to Fraction.

      A mixed fraction is represented as:

        wholeNumber (numerator/denominator)
      This method multiplies the whole number by the denominator then adds the numerator to the product. The result is then assigned as the new numerator while the denominator remains the same.
        The mixed fraction becomes:
          [(wholeNumber * denominator) + numerator]/denominator

      Returns:
      the converted MixedFraction as a new Fraction.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a String representation of the mixed fraction as "wholeNumber numerator/denominator".

      If the whole number is 0;

        this method returns the mixed fraction without its whole number. For example, 0 3/5 will be returned as 3/5.
      If the denominator is equal to 1;
        this method returns an integer equal to wholeNumber + numerator. For example, 2 2/1 will be returned as 4 (2 + 2).
      If the denominator is negative;
        both numerator and denominator will be multiplied to -1 so that a mixed fraction with a negative denominator will not be displayed as "wholeNumber numerator/-denominator," but "wholeNumber -numerator/denominator." For example, 2 18/-8 will be returned as 2 -18/8.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Fraction

    • toDouble

      public double toDouble()
      Returns this mixed fraction as double.
